body:
I briefly reviewed the code involved and it seems there are two places where a fix could be applied. Either in the checker itself or in `utils.get_argument_from_call` which is what it uses to retrieve the `encoding` argument.

Modifying `get_argument_from_call` to take into account **kwargs when a keyword argument is requested seems nice, but I don't know if it is too big of a change for stable.

Ok, it seems the actual problem is being able to get the kwargs from the function call.  The astroid node only contains the name of the variable used (in the example above `CSV_KWARGS`), but not its definition (the value it contains).

In order to get the actual values we'll have to use inference. I think we need to make sure we use inference only if absolutely necessary because of the performance impact and the fact that using a dict to pass arguments to ``open`` is far from the primary way to do it.

issue.title: Fix false positive `unspecified-encoding` when using kwargs

labels.name: False Positive ðŸ¦Ÿ
labels.description: A message is emitted but nothing is wrong with the code

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
False positives were being generated when passing arguments as kwargs to open() calls. This has been resolved by using inference inside `get_argument_from_call`.

This is an opt-in function, for inference to be used, `infer=True` must be specified when calling `get_argument_from_call`. This ensures that the rest of the codebase does not suffer a performance hit unnecessarily.

Closes #8719

body: Ah, inference is a nice thing, learnt something new. I made #8728 which puts it to the test. Let me know if I can do anything else to be of help.

issue.title: Use inference to determine if **kwargs is missing a named parameter

labels.name: Good first issue
labels.description: Friendly and approachable by new contributors

labels.name: False Negative ðŸ¦‹
labels.description: No message is emitted but something is wrong with the code

labels.name: Needs PR
labels.description: This issue is accepted, sufficiently specified and now needs an implementation

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
I would expect these two lines to raise the same set of messages. We don't use inference to analyze whether **kwargs contains the missing named parameter `x`. We could.

```python
import copy
import os

copy.copy(**{"y": os.environ})  # [unexpected-keyword-arg]
copy.copy(y=os.environ)  # [no-value-for-parameter, unexpected-keyword-arg]
```

False negative for `no-value-for-parameter`.

issue.title: Release branch for 2.17.5

labels.name: Maintenance
labels.description: Discussion or action around maintaining pylint or the dev workflow

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
What's new in Pylint 2.17.5?
----------------------------
Release date: 2023-07-26


False Positives Fixed
---------------------

- Fix a false positive for ``unused-variable`` when there is an import in a
  ``if TYPE_CHECKING:`` block and ``allow-global-unused-variables`` is set to
  ``no`` in the configuration.

  Closes #8696 

- Fix false positives generated when supplying arguments as ``**kwargs`` to IO
  calls like open().

  Closes #8719

- Fix a false positive where pylint was ignoring method calls annotated as
  ``NoReturn`` during the ``inconsistent-return-statements`` check.

  Closes #8747

- Exempt parents with only type annotations from the ``invalid-enum-extension``
  message.

  Closes #8830



Other Bug Fixes
---------------

- Fixed crash when a call to ``super()`` was placed after an operator (e.g.
  ``not``).

  Closes #8554 

- Fix crash for ``modified-while-iterating`` checker when deleting
  members of a dict returned from a call.

  Closes #8598 

- Fix crash in ``invalid-metaclass`` check when a metaclass had duplicate
  bases.

  Closes #8698 

- Avoid ``consider-using-f-string`` on modulos with brackets in template.

  Closes #8720. 

- Fix a crash when ``__all__`` exists but cannot be inferred.

  Closes #8740

- Fix crash when a variable is assigned to a class attribute of identical name.

  Closes #8754 

- Fixed a crash when calling ``copy.copy()`` without arguments.

  Closes #8774 



Other Changes
-------------

- Fix a crash when a ``nonlocal`` is defined at module-level.

  Closes #8735
